query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Ma poi che ’l gratular si fu assolto, 26 tacito coram me ciascun s’affisse, 27 ignito sì che vincëa ’l mio volto.
query.result:
**English:**
25 But after the greeting was over, 26 each one sat down silently before me, 27 glowing so that it overcame my face.
**Cornish:**
25 Mes wosa henna an commendya o wrug completis, 26 heb leverel owth setyas pub eyl dhe’n kyns vy, 27 owth lowena kepar owth fethas vy dhe’n front.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Ridendo allora Bëatrice disse: 29 «Inclita vita per cui la larghezza 30 de la nostra basilica si scrisse,
31 fa risonar la spene in questa altezza: 32 tu sai, che tante fiate la figuri, 33 quante Iesù ai tre fé più carezza».
query.result:
**English:**
28 Then Beatrice said, smiling: 29 «Illustrious life for whom the breadth 30 of our basilica was written,
31 make hope resound at this height: 32 you know that you have depicted it as many times 33 as Jesus showed greater affection to the three».
**Cornish:**
28 Owth hwithra wosa henna Beatrice a leveris: 29 «Bew byw glorius rag neb an brassa 30 a’n basilica ni a wrug skrif,
31 gwul an spyrans owth resona y’n uchelder ma: 32 te a wydh, owth pysas ef lies gweyth an figur, 33 kepar Iesu a wrug moy affection dhe’n tri».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 «Leva la testa e fa che t’assicuri: 35 che ciò che vien qua sù del mortal mondo, 36 convien ch’ai nostri raggi si maturi».
query.result:
**English:**
34 «Lift up your head and be assured: 35 for that which comes up here from the mortal world 36 must ripen in our rays».
**Cornish:**
34 «Codh dhe’n penn ha gwul owth bos sure: 35 rag an peth a wravia yma a-dhyworth an bys mortal, 36 yw rag omsettya y’n gwlow dhe vos maturi».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Questo conforto del foco secondo 38 mi venne; ond’ io leväi li occhi a’ monti 39 che li ’ncurvaron pria col troppo pondo.
query.result:
**English:**
37 This comfort from the fire then 38 came to me; whence I raised my eyes to the mountains 39 that had bowed them down before with their excessive weight.**Cornish:**
37 An gonfortma hemma tan ow 38 a dheuth dheum; owth uskis ow mynn ow hedhyow dhe'n menydhyow 39 a'n owth ogas dhe'n bys vyth aga dowr poos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 «Poi che per grazia vuol che tu t’affronti 41 lo nostro Imperadore, anzi la morte, 42 ne l’aula più secreta co’ suoi conti,
43 sì che, veduto il ver di questa corte, 44 la spene, che là giù bene innamora, 45 in te e in altrui di ciò conforte,
46 di’ quel ch’ell’ è, di’ come se ne ’nfiora 47 la mente tua, e dì onde a te venne».
query.result:
**English:**
40 “Since by grace it is willed that you confront 41 our Emperor, or rather Death, 42 in the most secret chamber with his counts,
43 so that, having seen the truth of this court, 44 the hope that down there rightly enkindles love, 45 may comfort you and others in this,
46 tell what it is, tell how your mind 47 is adorned with it, and tell where it came to you.”**Cornish:**
40 “Rag tas orth an ras vyth owth afronty 41 an Emperour ny, po dhe'n varow, 42 yn an owel kummyas gans aga kontys,
43 marow, wosa gweles an gwir a'n lysma, 44 an spyrans, a'n bys owth ena ynkar, 45 yn ty ha yn erel a'n gonfort,
46 leverel pyth yw, leverel pyth yw owth ena owth ena 47 an menydh dha, ha leverel pyth yw owth ena dheuth dhe'th.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
48 Così seguì ’l secondo lume ancora.
49 E quella pïa che guidò le penne 50 de le mie ali a così alto volo, 51 a la risposta così mi prevenne:
52 «La Chiesa militante alcun figliuolo 53 non ha con più speranza, com’ è scritto 54 nel Sol che raggia tutto nostro stuolo:
55 però li è conceduto che d’Egitto 56 vegna in Ierusalemme per vedere, 57 anzi che ’l militar li sia prescritto.
query.result:
**English:**
48 Thus the second light continued.
49 And that pious one who guided the feathers 50 of my wings to such a high flight, 51 anticipated me with this reply:
52 “The Church Militant has no son 53 with greater hope, as is written 54 in the Sun that illumines all our host:
55 therefore it is granted to him that from Egypt 56 he may come to Jerusalem to see, 57 before his soldiering is ended.**Cornish:**
48 Marow an eil golow a sewya.
49 Ha henna pius a ledyas an pluv 50 a'm eselyow dhe'n eyl vel uchel, 51 dhe'n dalleth marow a wra dhe'm.
52 “An Eglos Militans nyns eus mab 53 gans moy spyrans, marow yw skrifys 54 yn an Howl a wra dhe'n sklerhe an golon:
55 rag henna yw gonnys dhe'n ke dhe'n Ejyp 56 dhe'th dhe Jerusalem rag gweles, 57 kyns bos gorfenys aga soldyoryeth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Li altri due punti, che non per sapere 59 son dimandati, ma perch’ ei rapporti 60 quanto questa virtù t’è in piacere,
61 a lui lasc’ io, ché non li saran forti 62 né di iattanza; ed elli a ciò risponda, 63 e la grazia di Dio ciò li comporti».
query.result:
**English:**
58 The other two points, which are not asked 59 to gain knowledge, but so that he may report 60 how much this virtue pleases you,
61 I leave to him, for they will not be difficult for him 62 nor a cause for boasting; and let him answer this, 63 and may the grace of God grant him this.”**Cornish:**
58 An dhew benn aral, na rag gwybos 59 yw gemys, mes rag ev a wra riporta 60 pyth yw an virtudesma dhe'th bleser,
61 dhe'n ev owth yskyn, rag na wra yns i 62 kalet po bos iattans; ha henna dhe'n dalleth, 63 ha gras Dew dhe'n ev a wra gonfortya.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Come discente ch’a dottor seconda 65 pronto e libente in quel ch’elli è esperto, 66 perché la sua bontà si disasconda,
67 «Spene», diss’ io, «è uno attender certo 68 de la gloria futura, il qual produce 69 grazia divina e precedente merto.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Like a student who follows a teacher 65 readily and willingly in that in which he is expert, 66 so that his own goodness may be concealed,
67 “Hope,” I said, “is a certain expectation 68 of future glory, which divine grace produces 69 and preceding merit.”**Cornish:**
64 Marow dyskador a wra dhe'n doktor a sew, 65 prest ha lowen yn henna yw eksperys, 66 rag aga dhasvos aga dhasvos aga dhasvos,
67 “Spedhans”, me a leveris, “yw attendyans sur 68 a'n gloyr a dheuth, an huni a wra 69 gras Dew ha meret kyns.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Da molte stelle mi vien questa luce; 71 ma quei la distillò nel mio cor pria 72 che fu sommo cantor del sommo duce.
query.result:
**English:**
70 From many stars this light comes to me; 71 but he distilled it into my heart before 72 he was the supreme singer of the supreme leader.**Cornish:**
70 A le a steren meur an golowma 71 mes henna a'n destilis yn aga colon kyns 72 ev a veu kaner uhella'n kaner uhella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 ‘Sperino in te’, ne la sua tëodia 74 dice, ‘color che sanno il nome tuo’: 75 e chi nol sa, s’elli ha la fede mia?
76 Tu mi stillasti, con lo stillar suo, 77 ne la pistola poi; sì ch’io son pieno, 78 e in altrui vostra pioggia repluo».
query.result:
**English:**
73 “Let them hope in you,” he says in his theology, 74 “those who know your name”: 75 and who does not know it, if he has my faith?
76 You instilled it in me, with his instilling, 77 then in the Epistle; so that I am full, 78 and I pour down your rain on others.”**Cornish:**
73 “Sperino yn ty”, yn aga dheologi 74 a lever, “an re a wydh aga hanow”: 75 ha pyw na wydh, mar eus aga fydh?
76 Ty a'm destilis, gans aga destili, 77 yn an Epistel wosa; marow owth yn leun, 78 ha yn erel aga glaw owth yskyn.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Mentr’ io diceva, dentro al vivo seno 80 di quello incendio tremolava un lampo 81 sùbito e spesso a guisa di baleno.
query.result:
**English:**
79 While I was speaking, within the living core 80 of that fire a flash of lightning 81 trembled suddenly and often like a thunderbolt.**Cornish:**
79 Travia owth leverel, a-berth an kolon byw 80 a henna tan owth omwyskyn golow tan 81 dhesempys ha menowgh marow balen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Indi spirò: «L’amore ond’ ïo avvampo 83 ancor ver’ la virtù che mi seguette 84 infin la palma e a l’uscir del campo,
85 vuol ch’io respiri a te che ti dilette 86 di lei; ed emmi a grato che tu diche 87 quello che la speranza ti ’mpromette».
query.result:
**English:**
82 Then he breathed: "The love with which I burn 83 still towards the virtue that follows me 84 to the palm and to the exit from the field,
85 wants me to breathe to you who delight 86 in it; and it pleases me that you say 87 what hope promises you."
**Cornish:**
82 Wosa'thavollas: "An garow henna 83 a-dro dhe'n vertus henna a'm sew, 84 bys dhe'n palm ha dhe'n fordh a'n park,
85 a gar dhe'm dhe'n eneval dhe'n garow 86 dhe'n hi; ha henna a-wra dhe'm 87 henna a wra'n spyrans a-bromet dhe'n hi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 E io: «Le nove e le scritture antiche 89 pongon lo segno, ed esso lo mi addita, 90 de l’anime che Dio s’ha fatte amiche.
query.result:
**English:**
88 And I: "The new and the ancient scriptures 89 set the sign, and it shows me 90 of the souls that God has made his friends."
**Cornish:**
88 Ha my: "An nowyow ha'n skrifiow koth 89 a wra'n an sin, ha henna a'm diskwedh, 90 a'n enevalow a wra Dew dhynnergh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 E prima, appresso al fin d’este parole, 98 ‘Sperent in te’ di sopr’ a noi s’udì; 99 a che rispuoser tutte le carole.
query.result:
**English:**
97 And first, near the end of these words, 98 "Sperent in te" was heard above us; 99 to which all the dances responded.
**Cornish:**
97 Ha kyns, ogas dhe'n diwedh a'n gerow-ma, 98 'Sperent in te' a veu klevys a-ugh dhe'n ni; 99 dhe'n oll an carols a wra'n owthynnergh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Poscia tra esse un lume si schiarì 101 sì che, se ’l Cancro avesse un tal cristallo, 102 l’inverno avrebbe un mese d’un sol dì.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Then among them a light shone forth 101 so that, if Cancer had such a crystal, 102 winter would have a month of a single day.
**Cornish:**
100 Wosa henna, golow a skleris 101 mar po Kanser o jafas krystal henna, 102 an gwav a via mis a onan dydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 E come surge e va ed entra in ballo 104 vergine lieta, sol per fare onore 105 a la novizia, non per alcun fallo,
106 così vid’ io lo schiarato splendore 107 venire a’ due che si volgieno a nota 108 qual conveniesi al loro ardente amore.
query.result:
**English:**
103 And as a virgin, joyful and dancing, rises and goes and enters the dance 104 solely to do honor 105 to the bride, not for any fault,
106 so I saw the bright splendor 107 come to the two who were turning in a manner 108 befitting their ardent love.
**Cornish:**
103 Ha kepar gwregydh, lowen ha dansys, a lever ha mos ha mos dhe'n dans 104 hepken rag onor 105 dhe'n nowydh, nag rag kamm,
106 hemma a welas an skleris skler 107 dhe'n dhew dhe'n dew o trohe yn nota 108 kepar a wra gesys dhe'n karow tomm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Misesi lì nel canto e ne la rota; 110 e la mia donna in lor tenea l’aspetto, 111 pur come sposa tacita e immota.
query.result:
**English:**
109 It placed itself there in the song and in the dance; 110 and my lady kept her gaze on them, 111 just like a silent and motionless bride.
**Cornish:**
109 Yma a settys yn an kan ha'n dans; 110 ha'm benenes o jalleuchas y golwg orth, 111 kepar priodhes dell ha diyskyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 «Questi è colui che giacque sopra ’l petto 113 del nostro pellicano, e questi fue 114 di su la croce al grande officio eletto».
query.result:

112 "This is the one who lay upon the breast 113 of our pelican, and this was the one 114 chosen for the great office on the cross."
**Cornish:**
112 "Henna yw an hini a goske war bronn 113 an pelican ni, ha henna veu 114 a veu etholys rag an ober magh war an grows."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 La donna mia così; né però piùe 116 mosser la vista sua di stare attenta 117 poscia che prima le parole sue.
query.result:
**English:**
115 My lady spoke thus; but she did not 116 move her gaze from being attentive 117 after she first spoke her words.
**Cornish:**
115 An benenes hemma; mes nag a alla 116 mova y golwg dhyworth bos lettya 117 wosa henna kynsaf y gerow dhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Qual è colui ch’adocchia e s’argomenta 119 di vedere eclissar lo sole un poco, 120 che, per veder, non vedente diventa;
121 tal mi fec’ ïo a quell’ ultimo foco 122 mentre che detto fu: «Perché t’abbagli 123 per veder cosa che qui non ha loco?
124 In terra è terra il mio corpo, e saragli 125 tanto con li altri, che ’l numero nostro 126 con l’etterno proposito s’agguagli.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Like the one who peers and strains 119 to see the sun eclipsed a little, 120 who, in order to see, becomes blind;
121 such I became at that final fire, 122 while it was said: "Why do you dazzle yourself 123 trying to see something that has no place here?
124 My body is earth in the earth, and it will be there 125 with the others, until our number 126 is equal to the eternal plan.
**Cornish:**
118 Kepar an hini a wra'n ow adlokya ha owthynnergh 119 rag gweles an howl owthkudhla byghan, 120 neb, rag gweles, a wra'n owthdybri;
121 hemma a wrug dhe'm dhe'n tan a-dhiwedh 122 pan veu leverys: "Perag wrutha'th dall 123 rag gweles tra na wra'n owthfos yma?
124 Yn an nor yw nor an korf vy, ha'y via 125 gans an re erel, bys henna'n niver 126 owthkudhla dhe'n arbedh sempiternel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Con le due stole nel beato chiostro 128 son le due luci sole che saliro; 129 e questo apporterai nel mondo vostro».
query.result:
**English:**
127 With the two garlands in the blessed cloister, 128 are the two suns that rose; 129 and this you will bring to your world.
**Cornish:**
127 Gans an dhew golon yn an klester beunans, 128 yw an dhew golonlys a sevel; 129 ha henna a wra vy dhe'gas yn y'n bys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 A questa voce l’infiammato giro 131 si quïetò con esso il dolce mischio 132 che si facea nel suon del trino spiro,
133 sì come, per cessar fatica o rischio, 134 li remi, pria ne l’acqua ripercossi, 135 tutti si posano al sonar d’un fischio.
query.result:
**English:**
130 At this voice the fiery circle 131 grew quiet, along with the sweet mingling 132 that was made in the sound of the threefold breath,
133 just as, to cease toil or danger, 134 the oars, having first struck the water, 135 all come to rest at the sound of a whistle.
**Cornish:**
130 Orth an lef ma'th an kelgh termyn 131 a dheuthas skon gans an mesva dowr 132 a veu gwres yn son an eneth teirflogh,
133 kepar ha, rag gorfenna gwrians po peryll, 134 an remyow, wosa'gas kyns yn dowr, 135 oll a dheuth ha bos orth son an flugel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Ahi quanto ne la mente mi commossi, 137 quando mi volsi per veder Beatrice, 138 per non poter veder, benché io fossi
139 presso di lei, e nel mondo felice!
query.result:
**English:**
136 Ah, how I was moved in my mind, 137 when I turned to see Beatrice, 138 because I could not see her, though I was
139 near to her, and in the happy world!
**Cornish:**
136 Ah, pythvelyk omovys yn y'm spyrys, 137 pan droys vy dhe weles Beatrice, 138 rag na alla'm y gweles, byttegyns omovyn
139 ogas ogas dhedhi, ha'n bys a lowen!
